When there is an account of architecture, the latest trends of architecture, and the design of buildings, the deliberation on the topmost and the leading architects is mandatory. Architects are the ones who design the best of the best for our abodes, corporations and, other lodgings. Architects are the policymakers, they are truly the ones who research on construction materials, latest pieces of machinery and give advice in the architectural domain. In addition to this, the architects are the curators of our antique entities who devise theories, styles, and designs of the buildings as per the demand. With the passage of the last few decades, the precinct of architectural education has colossally flourished in Pakistan. Thence, the architectural domain of Pakistan has tremendously succeeded in fashioning the multifaceted paradigms of architecture. To elaborate this was all possible due to the upgrading latitude of architecture in our country. The refined and proficient architects are the pioneers and innovators of any social order who are the topmost architects. As a matter of fact, we already have enormously endowed talented and meticulous architects as luck would have it. Benevolently, the elevated scope of architecture has continued its persistence due to the efforts of the topmost architects of Pakistan. The hodgepodge of architects in Pakistan is growing infinite. However, their contributions rank them as the topmost architects of Pakistan.

The Topmost Architects of Pakistan

The architectural industry of Pakistan is full of incredible talents that are privileged worldwide. Here we have the assortment of the topmost and predominant architects who are ruling over the architectural sector of our country.

Jahangir Khan Sherpao, One of Pakistan’s Topmost Architects

It is immensely impossible to be unfamiliar with the name, Jahangir Khan Sherpao. Significantly, Jahangir Khan Sherpao is not in need of any introductory elucidation. The catalog of the architects is direly incomplete without citing the name of this legendary architect of our country. Jahangir Khan Sherpao is the honored President at the Institute of Architects Pakistan (IAP). Being a gigantic contributor to the architectural fraternity of the country, he honored as the Pride of Pakistan.

Additionally, Jahangir Khan Sherpao is also the Chief of ARCASIA, Architects Regional Council Asia from Pakistan. It is an association comprising 21 Asian countries counting Korea, Japan, China, and Mongolia. However, his portfolio is dynamically charged with the index of honors and recognization certificates and much more to mention. One of the most astonishing is the RIBA Presidential Medal from the Royal Institute of British Architects as Jahangir khan is a goodwill ambassador for Pakistan across the world. To cope with the frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, floods and other natural disasters he is planning to familiarize the architectural domain of our country with post-disaster training for architects.

 

Arif Hasan is a Pakistan’s Topmost Architect

Whosoever has a connection with the realm of architecture cannot be unaware of this legendary and leading architect in Pakistan, Arif Hasan. Notably, Arif Hasan is a qualified architect who has done his specialization in architecture from the Oxford Polytechnic. He has experience working with leading architectural agencies in Europe. After the return of the topmost architect of Pakistan, from Europe, he inaugurated his own independent isometrics that gradually emerged into allocating with national and international urban planning and development issues. Arif Hassan has also a noteworthy background in academics. He taught at Pakistani and European universities. His current and previous involvements are listed below.

It is worthy to mention that Arif Hassan is the beneficiary of Hilal-i-Imtiaz which is Pakistan’s premier award for the citizens. Here is the summary of one of the topmost architects in Pakistan; Arif Hassan’s ongoing and erstwhile ventures.

Here is a brief index of his amazing projects;

  • SOS Children’s Village, Karachi, May 1985.
  • Pakistan Institute of Labor Education and Research Complex, Karachi, 2000.
  • Nagarparkar Guest House Complex, 2009.
  • Crescent Model School, Lahore, 1966.
  • Sind Zamindar Hotel conservation, Karachi, 2004.

 

Nayyar Ali Dada; The Leading Architects of Pakistan

Among the topmost architects of Pakistan, Nayyar Ali Dada has a prominent place. It is believed that he is the one who brings modern architecture in Pakistan. Being the inventor and pioneer of modern architecture, he is the recipient of many awards. The catalog of his achievements and mesmeric endeavors is infinite.  Being one of the most celebrated architects, he is the recipient of Sitara-i-Imtiaz, Imtiaz -i-Halal And many others.

Some of the chief projects are,

  • Grand Jamia Mosque located in Bahria Town, Karachi.
  • Grand Jamia Mosque located in Bahria Town, Lahore.
  • Serena Hotel Islamabad.
  • Gaddafi Stadium located in Lahore.
  • Lahore Zoo.
  • Gaddafi Stadium Lahore.

 

Yasmeen Lari

Yasmeen Lari is Pakistan’s first female architect who is a degree-holder of Oxford Brookes University School of Architecture. Yasmeen Lari has a cosmic contribution to the architectural sector of Pakistan. Her most astounding projects were the Angoori Bagh Housing (ABH in 1978), the Taj Mahal Hotel in 1981, the Finance and Trade Center; FTC in 1989, and the Pakistan State Oil House; PSO Company headquarters in 1991. Along with that project she has also contributed to preserving the Historical civilization by the restoration of some projects such as Heritage Centre and Sethi house in Sethi Mohallah. In 1969, she also became an elected Member of the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA).
